title: My Portfolio Homepage
brief: My protfolio website written in Vue.js and Semantic UI.
description: My new homepage to demonstrate my Front-End developmenst skill to people. The site is built with the focus on responsive design and the ease to update in long term.
points: Used Vue.js to construct the website for cleaner code base
Utilized Responsive Design in Semantic UI
Plugged in lazy load images feature in Semantic UI
Generated site data from JSON files, the website can be updated without changing HTML or javascript
Used webpack for development and final assets deployment

title: My Portfolio (2014 version)
brief: My protfolio website written in Twitter Bootstrap and jQuery.
description: This website serves as my self-introduction to other people. It can be viewed on desktop, tablet or mobile devices. I also abstract project listings and descriptions into JSON files so that I can update the site easily in the future.
points: Use Twitter Bootstrap for responsive web design
Save project descriptions and links in JSON, and retrive them via jQuery AJAX methods when user clicks the project detail link

title: Small widgets
brief: Some web pages for practicing HTML5/CSS3/javascript and jQuery.
description: Some web pages for practicing HTML5, CSS3 and javascript, including multiple versions of analog clock and star rating.
points: drawed an analog clock with pure DOM elements and css
designed a calculator without using "eval()" method

title: A Fast Solution for Network Design
brief: Implemented an algorithm covered in class, and generated graphs by using python-igraph.
description: A linear programming algorithm in order to find a network design that has the minimal cost in a given network graph.
points: Implemented Dijkstra's algorithm in Java to find shortest path between two nodes in a graph
Generated graphs for project report by using a graph generating library python-igraph

title: (Team Project) SIP User Agent Remote Controller
description: A Java Applet that can remotely control a SIP User Agent over the network to make a call or receive a call.
points: Created a message-oriented protocol between a Java Applet and a Java program.
Modified Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) to meet project requirements.
Investigated an open source Java package (MjSip)

screenshots.caption: http messages between Http server on Sip user agent and web browser
message protocol for calling from web browser
message protocol for calling from another Sip user agent
message protocol for closing a call
A sip user agent written in Java Swing and MjSip
Java Applet for users to remote control their sip user agent

title: (Team) Distributed Mutual Exclusion Algorithm
description: A quorum-based and token-based mutual exclusion algorithm in a distributed system.
points: Applied TCP Socket programming in C on Linux
Practiced Linux commands and tools
Used JIRA for project management

screenshots.caption: our algorithm's performance compare to Maekawa's algorithm

title: JTChat
brief: An IRC client written in Java Swing
description: An Internet Relay Chat (IRC) program designed for users of a popular video streaming website, Twitch.tv.
points: Implemented a simple IRC bot by Java TCP socket packages.
Learned to write a GUI program with JAVA Swing.
Analyzed and handled customized IRC control messages made by Twitch.

screenshots.caption: simulate "delete banned messages" functionality on Twitch.tv
has ability to parse Twitch-customized messages and display nickname colors

title: Block Attack
description: A mini game written in python and pygame
points: (Use arrow keys to control)
(Game objective: do not get crushed by those blocks!)

title: Prolog Program Contest 2008
brief: Implemention of questions from Prolog Program Contest 2008
description: Implemention of questions from Prolog Program Contest 2008 with SWI-Prolog. Please refer to the project GitHub page for details and outputs.

title: (Team) Insurance Management Database System
description: A relational database for Insurance companies and agencies.
points: Designed an enhanced entity-relationship (EER) model from requirement documents
Converted the EER model to a relational model
Performed SQL queries with Oracle SQLPlus on a Unix machine

title: (Team) Java Multi Language File Mover and Renamer
brief: A batch file renamer written in Java Swing
description: A batch file renamer written in Java Swing with different rename options.
points: Batch rename files and folders with [Prefix][serial numbers] format
Batch search and replace certain string in file and folder names
Batch move files and folders to another folder
Multi language support in UI

title: (Team) Spaces and Equipments Rental Management System
brief: A database implementation for renting spaces and properties in the university
description: A relational database design and implementation for renting spaces and equipments in the university.
points: Designed an entity-relationship (ER) model from real life example
Converted the ER model to a relational model
Wrote SQL queries with Oracle SQLPlus
Implemented simple user interface to interact with Database with php

title: Awari
brief: Awari game written in MFC with an AI Player
description: A GUI Awari game that contains an AI player based on my own evaluation function and a debug mode which you can adjust game state for testing the AI player.
points: Implemented the game in MFC
Designed my own strategy for winning the game
Implemented my strategy as evaluation function for the AI player
Abstracted the game into state representations for computing next move and debug mode

title: (Team) Xiangqi (Chinese Chess)
brief: Chinese Chess game written in MFC
description: Chinese Chess game written in MFC with full color gameboard UI.
points: Timers for each turn
Game log for each turn
Save the whole log after a game is end
Replay a game by loading a game log

title: (Team) Minesweeper Battle
brief: 2-player minesweeper game written in webpage and javascript
description: This game is a recreation of Minesweeper Flags game in MSN with web page and javascript. Two players against each other and whoever finds the most mines wins the game.
points: Used javascript to generate game board and clickable squares
Used CSS to position the game layout
Wrote the game with VanillaJS only (no any 3rd-party plugin)

title: Calculator (C++)
description: A calculator that can parse math expressions and do the computation
points: Support operators: +-*/
Identify operator orders (handle *,/ prior to +,-)
Support minus numbers
Support parentheses in expression
Accept a space between numbers and operators in expression
Reject invalid expression

title: Minesweeper (C++)
description: A Minesweeper game written in C++ that is similiar to Minesweeper game in Windows XP.
points: Implemented flag and expand feature
Offered game customization options
Utilized 3rd party cpp file to provide screen refresh functionality
